Package com.foreach.across.core.support

Interface ReadableAttributes

All Known Subinterfaces:
WritableAttributes
All Known Implementing Classes:
AttributeOverridingSupport, AttributeSupport
public interface ReadableAttributes
Interface defining a generic contract for accessing metadata from arbitrary objects. Attributes are defined by a String key. This interface also provides shortcut methods where an attribute is defined by a Class which name is the unique attribute key and the value is assumed to be an instance of that Class.

  • Method Details

    • getAttribute

      <Y, V extends Y> V getAttribute(Class<Y> attributeType)
      Get the value of the attribute identified by attributeType. The attribute name will be the class name, and the value will be coerced to the type specified. Return null if the attribute doesn't exist.
      Parameters:
      attributeType - the unique attribute type
      Returns:
      the current value of the attribute, if any

    • getAttribute

      Object getAttribute(String attributeName)
      Get the value of the attribute identified by attributeName. Return null if the attribute doesn't exist.
      Parameters:
      attributeName - the unique attribute key
      Returns:
      the current value of the attribute, if any

    • getAttribute

      <Y, V extends Y> V getAttribute(String attributeName, Class<Y> attributeType)
      Get the value of the attribute identified by attributeName. The value will be coerced to the attributeType specified. Return null if the attribute doesn't exist.
      Parameters:
      attributeName - the unique attribute key
      Returns:
      the current value of the attribute, if any

    • hasAttribute

      boolean hasAttribute(Class<?> attributeType)
      Return true if the attribute identified by attributeType exists. Otherwise return false.
      Parameters:
      attributeType - the unique attribute key

    • hasAttribute

      boolean hasAttribute(String attributeName)
      Return true if the attribute identified by attributeName exists. Otherwise return false.
      Parameters:
      attributeName - the unique attribute key

    • attributeNames

      String[] attributeNames()
      Return the names of all attributes.

    • attributeMap

      Map<String,Object> attributeMap()
      Return a Map view of all attributes.
      Returns:
      map containing all attributes, usually not modifiable
